Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, which has flaked away in places, and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394362) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394362)
